newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan PM says to keep close watch on stock prices.
newsitem.headline: Japan PM says to keep close watch on stock prices.

text.p: Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto said on Wednesday that he would keep close watch on Tokyo's stock price movements.
Commenting on measures to cope with recently weak stock prices, Hashimoto told a session of parliament's Lower House that Japan's economic fundamentals are "not bad at all".
"I will keep close watch on the stock market," he said.

Japan would continue its "seamless" economic policies by pursuing early passage of a supplementary budget for this fiscal year and the main budget for 1997/98 in the current parliamentary session, which started on Monday, he said.
Hashimoto added that the economy was continuing a gradual recovery with capital spending and private consumption leading the way.
